author: Anna Engelbrecht

review: Bought the Amazon Fire TV for my "dumb" TV in the bedroom. Already had Amazon Prime subscription so it only made sense. Never owned any other set top box, so I don't have anything to compare to. It is, however, much faster and easier than the interface of my "smart" TV and Bluray player. The box is very easy to set up and use. It has a nice low profile, but a larger footprint than the competition. I have mine hooked up with an Ethernet cable to maximize speed and stability. My only gripe with the design is the bright white LED on the front. The interface is fast and simple to use. Streaming video quality is excellent. Not quite Bluray, but close enough for most people. I haven't played any games on it. Not sure if I will. The game pad is available separately. The included remote is small and simple. I've only used the voice search once-"Gary Busey", and it worked. I've read that the voice search won't work inside of 3rd party apps like Netflix. Overall a great product, if you need a streaming device. A perfect compliment to a Prime subscription. Free access to a huge library of TV/movies. The packaging and unboxing alone are worth a hundred bucks.
